#| echo: false

library(plotly)

# Dados
df <- data.frame(
  language = factor(
    c("Python", "R", "SQL", "Quarto", "HTML5/CSS", "DAX", "VBA"),
    levels = c("Python", "R", "SQL", "Quarto", "HTML5/CSS", "DAX", "VBA")
  ),
  since = c(2021, 2008, 2020, 2022, 2022, 2016, 2003),
  knowledge = c(7, 8, 7, 8, 6, 5, 6)
)
df$knowledge <- df$knowledge * 10

# Logos
logos <- list(
  "Python"    = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/github/explore/main/topics/python/python.png",
  "R"         = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/github/explore/main/topics/r/r.png",
  "SQL"       = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/github/explore/main/topics/sql/sql.png",
  "Quarto"    = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/github/explore/main/topics/quarto/quarto.png",
  "LaTeX"     = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/github/explore/main/topics/latex/latex.png",
  "VBA"       = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/microsoft/PowerBI-Icons/main/Icons/Product/excel.png",
  "DAX"       = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/microsoft/PowerBI-Icons/main/Icons/Product/dax%20(DB).svg",
  "HTML5/CSS" = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/devicons/devicon/master/icons/html5/html5-original.svg"
)

# Cores baseadas em escala de roxo
base_colors <- RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(n = 7, name = "Purples")
bar_colors <- rev(colorRampPalette(base_colors)(7))

fig <- plot_ly()

for (i in seq_len(nrow(df))) {
  fig <- fig |> add_trace(
    type = "bar",
    orientation = "h",
    x = df$knowledge[i],
    y = df$language[i],
    name = df$language[i],
    marker = list(color = bar_colors[i]),
    text = paste0(df$knowledge[i], "%"),
    textposition = "inside",
    insidetextfont = list(color = "white", size = 14),
    hoverinfo = "text",
    hovertext = paste0("Knowledge considered => ", df$language[i], ": ", df$knowledge[i], "%\nUsing since ", df$since[i])
  )
}

fig <- fig |> layout(
  barmode = "stack",
  title = list(text = "", x = 0.5),
  xaxis = list(
    range = c(0, 100),
    showgrid = FALSE,
    zeroline = FALSE,
    title = NULL
  ),
  yaxis = list(
    autorange = "reversed",
    title = NULL
  ),
  plot_bgcolor = "#333333",
  paper_bgcolor = "#333333",
  font = list(color = "white"),
  showlegend = FALSE,
  margin = list(l = 180, r = 50, t = 60, b = 60)
) |> config(displayModeBar = FALSE)

fig
